p: Polyphenols being present in a wide spectrum of plant organs, they are easily found in numerous agro-industrial wastes/by-products, offering several possibilities for their valorization. First of all, an excellent polyphenol source is represented by the main by-products of wine production, namely: pomace, skins, and seeds. In particular, molasses seeds have a high flavonoids content, and molasses pomace is rich in tannins [ 60]. Grape pomace contains gallic acid, syringic acid, vanillic acid, catechin, isoquercitrin, and epicatechin [ 61]. The presence of these antioxidant metabolites [ 60, 61] makes the wine by-products useful additives for ruminant feed [ 62]. In addition to the antioxidant potential, pomace also shows anti-cholesterol activity [ 63], while tannins from pomace are also used as wood adhesive [ 64].
